intro: Ardisia breedlovei, commonly known as the Hawaiian ardisia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, urn-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and streambanks. Its leaves are glossy and dark green, while its berries are red and toxic to humans and livestock. Ardisia breedlovei plays an important ecological role in its native environment, supporting local wildlife and contributing to the biodiversity of Hawaiian ecosystems.
